constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 4 (Wednesday, January 6, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. ESHOO:
H.R. 221.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Clause 3 of article VI of the Constitution.
In McCulloch v. Maryland, 17 U.S. 316 (1819), the Supreme
Court stated, ``Yet he would be charged with insanity who
should contend that the legislature might not superadd to the
oath directed by the Constitution such other oath of office
as its wisdom might suggest.''
[Page H116]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to modify the oath of office taken by individuals in the civil service or uniformed services, and of other purposes.
